4UNc3fm6eTcO7GHk7XU9qA.text: This is my boyfriend and my favorite place to go for AYCE sushi. There's never a line, parking is easy, your food comes out fast, it's always fresh, and there's a huge selection. The hours are great, too. My only complaints are that the staff could be a little bit more personable, and sometimes the music in there is very loud.

kVSo3SaeG4ZdyBlsGQIwoQ.text: Okay well this place has a sign that says to write them a review for 10% off so I wrote this review to get the 10% off but I'm not even sure if they took the 10% off on the bill.. Anyways ! The all you can eat sushi is like $26 a person and we were kinda iffy on it but then we took that gamble and the food quality was not as good as I hoped ): we were supposed to go to goyemon but the wait was literally an hour so we decided to go to sushi 21 since it was near by . We walked in and the restaurant was basically empty and so we sit and the waitress took our order . They forgot my baked mussels a couple of times that I asked and did I mention the quality of the food wasn't that good ? Idk it might be just me coming from Hawaii (with some of the freshest yummiest fish) to Vegas with some crappy not as fresh  quality fish but yeah the mussels tasted like over cooked really hard chewy mussles with some really bold sauce to cover it up . And the miso soup was SOO salty omg my mother couldn't even finish it because she said it was waaaay too salty for her . But the spicy poki was actually kinda good only cuz it was really spicy but to also add the fish was still extra chewy bleh . We also ordered a yum yum roll and that was pretty bland not as "yum yum" as I expected . The wonton soup though is good I'd recommend but the portion is SOO little you'll probably finish it in a couple of bites . Overall I wish I dined at goyemon tonight instead but it's always good to try new places and I can't say it was completely disgusting since it did fill me up so 2 stars because the customer service wasn't terrible but only 2 stars because $26 for a person for such low quality food is not agreeable to my standards

_45NWyBMhzpT7WSUgdUXtg.text: Seems like this place has gotten a majority of their negative reviews very recently...   We ordered a teriyaki chicken dish, the middle pieces were literally raw... ShoKuWwgOow917lW83LR0Q.text: The food was good at first but I won't say excellent it was the crappy service from the servers who were reluctant to give us our rounds for all you can eat sushi and really gave bad attitude. only thing that did help was on the way out the chef was very gracious and nice. service from the waitresses were horrible

cOgh24PUrkelzLNrSy8yPw.text: My friends and I enjoyed this place. The fish quality is good. Service is friendly. We had a great time ordering AYCE sushi here :)

Hpq3CuSqvN0ZHHo2G9rGFA.text: I would 100% recommend this to any sushi lover  The service was amazing  The sushi was awesome.     And to finish it off  The dessert was really good as well  My favorite roll of the night was the Vegas lasagna roll   I will be back  thank you sushi 21

4Gnl15ZOfzeOxI_opSXzhg.text: I know that for all-you-can-eat sushi you have to eat all the rice or get charged for it, but do you have to eat all the fish? ;)  1.5 stars. I usually round up but here I'm rounding down for the dishonesty of their check-in scam.  We were craving sushi around 1am and this was the only AYCE we saw that was open past 2am.  Service was friendly and not inattentive though that may have had to do with the fact that we were the only ones there at 1am (despite their supposedly closing at 3am).  Last call is posted in the window as 2:15 but when we sat down we were informed last call was at 1:45am. Did not contest the sign on the door. Maybe they changed their hours, but if that is the case then they needed to also change their signs.  The sushi rice was too sweet.  Fish across the board was not very fresh.  Uni was not great. The brighter the color, the better. Pale or brown uni has either a plasticky or seaweedy (and not in a good way) taste to it. These were pretty brown, but surprisingly not as awful as at JJANGA or Goyemon.  Oysters were far from the worst I'd ever had, but the freshness of a raw seafood item is still worryingly called into question when you feel the need to put lemon slices directly on it.  Snow crab was so cloyingly sweet it was sweeter than the shaved ice we had at Chada St on Tuesday. It did not taste like crab at all, real *or* fake.  We asked for no sauce on anything but they only remembered to not put sauce on our shrimp tempura roll, which had surprise "krab" (fake crab) in it.  Which brings me to the rolls. Rolls on the special, baked, and fried rolls lists (basically everything that was not on the traditional roll list) were not very varied. Almost everything had fake crab in it even if it was not a listed ingredient. Everything that didn't have krab had spicy tuna and everything that didn't have spicy tuna had krab.  We ended up only getting a couple rolls because after they couldn't get "no sauce"" right we were not confident they would be able to do "no crab" reliably and did not want to fill our stomachs with that sweet crud.  Disappointed that they had run out of tempura green tea ice cream. I wasn't sure how they could still have green tea ice cream and still have tempura and not have tempura green tea ice cream (I had horrific thoughts of soggy, pre-tempura'd ice cream dancing rudely in my head, but the DH informed me that they have to super-freeze a ball of ice cream in order to tempura it without it melting, and that this takes 2 hours or more, so apparently that's how).  Don't like the scam they're running for the check-in discount. Have encountered the whole "write good review for a discount" scam before, but never seen it attached to a check-in, or seen a place where they want the review up front. Makes no sense.

Qk6pS70czUJwEZq8HAI-Cw.text: Really good, fast and friendly service, place is really clean and really easy to chose of the out the menu, all you can eat option is really worth the price.

3MHuOjhTznBdIjhVhxp6LQ.text: inside a large strip mall towards the back stores...christmas lights hung around..kpop playing in the background...korean sushi restaurant...typical menu of bento, sushi and rolls...finding an ayce option of $21.95 lunch and $26.95 dinner...not necessary unless training for ifoce...portions are large and filling...taking the sushi combo b with choice of 3 fish $14.95...tempura, soup and salad included....standard miso soup good...nice sized bowl of salad in sweet and tangy dressing...vegetable tempura was excellent...light batter, crispy and sweet dipping sauce was delicious...selecting tuna, yellowtail and red snapper for the 3 choices...coming in pairs to make it 6 pieces...traditional sizing and presentation...not overly large and just a perfect bite...very good...4 pieces of california roll included too...rolled too tight, but good looking...sushi rice was bit dry and lacking...overall a good dinner under $20...

JlhSD1P5fDMIFnwqHbD11g.text: Wow! Great all you can eat sushi menu. Over 80 unique rolls to choose from, as well as a large list of your classic rolls (California, spicy tuna, etc.), hot and cold appetizers and desserts.   Service was super friendly, knowledgeable, gave recommendations and was FAST. Food came out so quickly! We actually had to slow down our ordering because we're used to all-you-can-eat places being slow. Not this place! Fast and fresh.  Definitely recommend this restaurant. It's only 5 minutes west of The Strip, too, so if you're in town visiting, it's a quick cab or drive over.

NxvXa91f7qZL8xgCPrEbMg.text: At the Frias Center, we dined at Sushi 21 after our late night flight. It was very crowded at 10pm, we had to wait a while until a table opened up. My sister in law was craving sushi and found this spot. It was about $26.95 all you can eat. But if you order too much and don't finish, you'll be charged extra. I wish I could eat $27 worth of food but I have a tiny appetite..so hubby and his brother ate more than enough to cover me.. Food was good, but ever since my proposal at Yellow Tail in the Bellagio, no sushi or Japanese dish will ever come close to the best meal I had over there.. On that note, this sushi joint wasn't all that bad. I enjoyed trying out new dishes and sushi rolls. Although the food was served a little slower because they were busy..but overall, it's a great spot to try out. Some of what we ordered was spicy garlic Edamame, miso soup, my first time trying eel Brown dragon roll, and baked mussel.

Vf55-rBjKsgyylmjZpaA7A.text: My sister and I had the taste for sushi last night and this place came up so...no hesitation. We ordered the seaweed salad, avocado rolls, vegetable tempura and some spicy edamame. The tempura was decent however it was super greasy and there were some pieces missing. The avo rolls were beautifully sized -like the best I've ever seen and the avocado was nicely ripened not over ripe. My sister had the seaweed salad and gave it great reviews. Lastly the spicy garlic edemame was nicely seasoned with the right amount of spice. One thing I'd like to see improve with this company is their takeout order presentation. Since it was a takeout order I would've loved if they packed empty plastic ramekins so we could pour the soy sauce into it. I had also asked for extra wasabi as part of the order but they gave us the tiniest amount  complete opposite of what I asked for. All in all this was not the best but it did suffice. With so many sushi spots in the area it's hard to be the best.

dHvVCluPVmc44gcd3P3XwQ.text: The cook was amazing. Made gorgeous rolls very quickly and all of the ingredients and even the decor were fresh. They remodeled inside and it looks great and I love recommending people to come here.  This place would have five stars if the waitresses were a little better.  This was my favorite sushi restaurant for two years and unfortunately I'm never going back. The last time I was there I never got three rolls I ordered on the slip of paper or the appetizer I ordered. My friend and I had such a bad experience we didn't even care about not getting the rolls we wanted to leave. We wanted to be there 1 hour ended up being two because of how long we waited for everything. The worst part is that before we left an older women who was working there or helping out cane up and started touching her hair out of nowhere without asking in the middle of us eating then had the nerve to tell us to rate them high on yelp. So disappointing since it was my absolutely favorite place. Never again

VUfPnijk2Yb-Ff2v7UvVeg.text: We eat here often when we come to Vegas. They have a huge selection of sushi and rolls, plus the have all you can eat options that allow you to eat way too much.  Yeah, there are many places with better decor, but the food and service here is excellent

3VFQmm3J1cnI06oi8fmP9A.text: We went for AYCE but let me down sushi 21 Our first round order came fast then when we put second order, took forever!  We waited like 30min All other tables coming in orders but not our table  We asked server what's going on   He replied orders are backed up but i see only 3 tables were occupied & maybe 3 couples at counter  I guess time to find another sushi place now  Good bye sushi 21

WgJhWK-Kf0KvLd10yPfwXw.text: Excellent sushi,  we had a great experience! We ate family style,  supper friendly attentive staff,  They have almost 100 rolls! Also offer all u can eat sushi. Sashimi is fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wxB1ICe-ymf_FsYwXUkgLg.text: This is my go to all you can eat spot in Vegas. I'm not a local but travel here for work quite a bit.  Here's my MO: Start with a Spicy Poke over a seaweed salad! Yum Then order a few traditional sushi pieces ( I stick to yellowtail, red snapper, and of course salmon) Yum again Then hit the rolls... I love spicy, so most of my selections come hot! My favorites thus far are the kamikaze, ugly, and the double yellowtail... Oh order 1/2 rolls so you can try even more of their variety. They have over 100 rolls to pick from!  Now, remember....it's an AYCE sushi place so don't expect Top Grade fish... it's not Jiro's place... but  it is still pretty good... with that being said. Hope you enjoy the grub.  Oh... service is good too! No complaints other than the fact that I asked for a miso three different times and it was never brought out... but meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi 21 Roll
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9r402RZiLN27ZslTNwMxmg.text: This place was recommended by my sister sooo many times so I decided to give it a try. The food was really good but the reason I gave it 4 stars because of the weird vibe service we got...   Me and my friend went went there on a Monday evening, there was no other customers there when we arrived. We got seated at the booth next to the cashier, the waiter immediately asked if it was my first time here and I said yes then he gave me the ayce menu, just right after I got the menu, the waitress was standing next to him immediately asked if we wanted to put in kitchen order?!? I just said it was my FIRST TIME here. I didn't even have 5 secs to look at the menu. We ordered our food and it came out very quickly. And while we're eating, the same waitress was standing like 2 steps away from our table and kept staring at our table almost the whole time.... I felt like I was being watched  but other than that. The whole experience was great. Will be back when I'm in the area!

RELa9eyp_wHxIqElke4rpg.text: Super clean place. My server was amazing. He was always checking up on us at all times making sure my little family had enough table space for our AYCE dinner. I am super amazed how tasty and beautiful the food looked. It was definitely made perfectly unlike some places rushing to get you in and out. I would definitely rate this place a 100 start, because the owner came up to me to offer holding my baby while I eat. Who does that? Amazing!!! Every time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be back. Must go to with such delicious prepared top of the line sushi!

h2BMaaEtnH_W7lyQJEJH1w.text: Came for lunch, parking was ample and convenient.  No wait times which was appreciated when eating with kids.    Lunch AYCE adult is $21.95 and kids under 10 are half off for AYCE. Ala Carte is also available if you are not that hungry reasonably priced.   The Lunch Bento specials are a great value and very generous in portion size.    Verdict: AYCE is a good value if you're pretty hungry. The sushi is fresh and good portions.  Large variety of items that you can choose from in the menu including premium rolls that are priced normally between 10-14$. Remember no wasting and no sharing on the AYCE. The tempura and sushi was very good. Large restaurant able to fit larger parties. Good value and don't forget 10% yelp check in discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujYxVKMC2ZGQUTyVEayxKw.text: I never reviewor give complaints. But this place had horrible service. Waitress and hostess, didn't talk and I feel our family was not welcome ,very very uncomfortable experience, but my son loves sushi and I was very hungry, BUT they either Completely IGNORE us!!! We discussed we will never come back Funniest first time, when we leave they said Thank you... OMG!!!! Very very uncomfortable dinner experienced I never had.

6gFWHhtVXiOE9T2CutbjGg.text: Have eaten here a number of times already, and the food is consistently good, and not too hard on the Wallet. The lunch bento is a good value, and they also have Korean dishes like Kalbi and bulgogi. They also offer AYCE which I had once.  Don't expect a fancy place. The interior is simply furnished, maybe even a little tattered. But the food is good, and when it is slow the sushi chefs will throw you a few extras.

Qh3JKahsQyqqtupmI2wl1g.text: I use to love going to this place. My roommate and I would go at least once a month. But the last time we went, the owner kept touching my hair and kept asking for a good review on yelp. I would have gave her a great review, but touching people's hair without permission or without knowing them is not okay.

37q6b909wgE2BkedRz5FgA.text: Delightful food, especially loved the Vegas roll, and portion sizes were grand. Service was great, but we did dine early to beat the rush. My mate tried the blackberry sake and it was delicious, though a tad sweet. The deep fried Oreo is everything you would imagine, and then some!

JS6QZwZCmYvAAFZdtYrVog.text: Ambience - so so nothing much special about it! (Neutral)  Food - mediocre all you can eat sushi i'll say. Sushi rice doesn't really taste rice. Fish not too fresh like sushi bars. Never tried raw fish in other sushi places in vegas so can't really tell. (Nah)  Service - service is fast enough. (Yes!)  Sorry I am not impressed about the taste and ambience at all but nice service!

64o45Qjr_KCKmbbORRUoeQ.text: This place was awesome! Totally had a great ayce experience with my fam bam and friends. The service was great. We especially loved the deep fried oreos, oh my yum!!! We will definitely be back soon!!!

tST1xzEOyU_PxiDo4jSmmA.text: Great food!!   Great service.  Grilled yellow tail collar to die for.  Sushi very good

y_2I-O6eMNcTr4I_dmhXJA.text: The food is okay....but I had a bad experience with them last time and the food is not that good to go back there.   I had a discount coupan from yelp for sushi 21 when I got there the waitress started making excuses and eventually said we only do this for people who eat here and yours is a take out. It was only a 2 dollar discount but they arguing and making up excuses for 2 dollars specially in a very rude manner was a bummer. I would not go back..specially it is very close to Goyemon sushi its so easy to switch.

Em2Q5Ox0IeFxZuWLUrl17g.text: The fish was very fresh and tasty! Their all you can eat menu was very diverse and their staff is friendly and attentive!

AvMNyDKLrZ961EH7z1qs4Q.text: This place is well decorated and the staff there are so nice and helpful. Foodwise, it is okay. Its definitely an American sushi place and for what it is it does it well.

_b6dd3C9WDU1a9Sc-T9k4A.text: The sushi was delicious and if you're really hungry, the all you can eat sushi special cant be beat.  It's about as much as two full rolls, so if you're not eating more than that, then just order the rolls you want.  I loved the Sushi 21 roll and the "I Love My Ass" roll too.  Just hearing the cute server say the name of that one was enough reason to order it, but it tasted really great too.  The prices were reasonable with most full size rolls between 9 and 13 dollars.  The service was very attentive and friendly, and the free refills on drinks were nice too.  I enjoyed it eating in and ordered it delivery the following day.  It was just as good the second time.  It's definitely my first choice for sushi.

zBaXBozfdXAIJPeSVGcrPQ.text: This is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant (if not absolute favorite overall restaurant). Service and food are always excellent (and I've been here probably at least 20 times in the last 2 years). It is perfect if you're looking for fresh sushi at a very reasonable price. Sushi 21 does not have exotic fish, but it has all the basics, including my favorites (uni, sweet shrimp, spicy tuna, salmon, salmon roe, yellowtail, etc). It is casual/low-key so it may not be your romantic first-date place, but it's your staple where you go to get fresh sushi and great service at a good price...  i really loved the "I LOVE MY ASS" roll... It's the best!!!

TFlx9dRBgOoMVTNq5ykIrw.text: One of my favorite places to get sushi! Always delicious and fresh, never had any issues.

vIPK6FDuDFDMRko-vA4z_A.text: I usually don't write reviews but this Sushi 21 place was by far the worst sushi I have ever had. We did the all you can eat so we were able to try a bunch of different items and every one of them was really bad. Nothing is made fresh. Everything is frozen and the result is no flavor, awkward unpleasant textures and very poor quality. Presentation was also weird. Even the pickled ginger was flavorless and harsh to eat. I can't think of anything positive about the experience and I felt like my money was completely wasted. It was completely empty which should have been our first sign to walk right out before even sitting down. I can't believe it is still in business. It makes me never want to stray away from Kaya again which does almost everything well.

n39vIZIXl3z3XrN5DUeVsg.text: Although the sushi rolls tasted great the service was less than spectacular, felt like we where a burden to the servers by having to ask for more water or to order more food, there was no constant checkins to see how we were doing.

U_4D-5ihbvkMpM8x03d88A.text: I went here a couple days ago and I enjoyed it! Most sushi places are the same with all-u-can-eat, but I liked the Swat sushi roll here, along with the Las Vegas roll and spicy tuna roll is a must. The Baked Lobster roll is interesting, with the sushi roll pieces layed out flat and the clawfish on top of  giving it a unique look.

ZNw5vmMr8FTdk1RhEe4-UQ.text: Love their food. Service is also good! I had the kamikaze and something wrong 69. I loved the kamikaze!! I'll for sure be back!!

9hSQbXBR74qvijuIlZQCgg.text: Don't we all hate to order food  " to go" and to discover while already at home that they missed something from your order?  Driving back there is not worth at this time ....

M_F6J04haemWdMYGFIn3ig.text: Food was good, loved the mussels and sushi had a good fish to rice ratio. I like how it's a pretty big place so hardly have to wait for a table. Good ayce deal!! And 10% off with yelp checkin

iN5HtdIg2WT5NvfjEpmPCQ.text: Great spot for all you can eat. My go to sushi place in vegas. Staff super friendly, food tastes great.

LwdLfcaowbeJbwHjdOPSEw.text: No wait, which was awesome.  Food was really good for the first few plates, but predictably quality went down for the last few plates. Can't blame them for that though.  We came here after we went to goyemon and the wait was 2 hours there... service was good and I'd recommend it. 26.95 for ayce.

rU9v4RWqqHsC0C5MirKX0Q.text: Great service, knowledgable staff--wonderful food. Food came fast. And the music videos in the background were awesome. We'll come again!   Wish there was 6 stars to select.

QJolz9icEH-2V0iKrtTxww.text: Very good food! Service was fast, the whole staff was on the ball. Great teamwork! Will come back and tell people about it

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried Oreo

Glz6j36x5TMZERw70upHUw.text: Used to love this place until last night. I called before heading over to the complete opposite end of town, guy who answered said they served all you can eat up to 130-2am. So we drive all the way over there only to be told 1) I didn't really call there (the rude guy at door even made me show him my phone that I called there) and 2) they only serve take out. It was 138am. Guy was so damn rude, they have lost a few customers in me and my friends. I'll never be back. Don't say one thing and do differently when you have customers. There were two of us, we knew what we wanted before we sat down because we frequent this place.... never again will I step foot into this place or recommend it to ANYONE! Learn a little thing about customer service .. Rude a&& service!!

IbblsdXQWxsRVS5mAocneQ.text: My boyfriend, best friend and I wanted to go to Yama sushi at first but it was a 30-45 min wait so we decided to go to Goyemon instead. Unfortunately for us, it also had a 30 min wait. Instead we opted for Sushi 21. My boyfriend has been here before but my best friend and I haven't.   Their AYCE sushi price is the usual price of $21 for lunch and $27 for dinner but for $10 extra, they also include an all you can drink for hot sake and beer. I haven't heard of any sushi joint doing all you can drink before! It was pretty cool. Their special rolls were alright. Nothing I tried really wow'd me so far but it wasn't bad either. That all you can drink menu though, is worth coming here!

lgKGEtudXrPFhZwpjrPESw.text: This place hit the spot for late lunch/early dinner...rolls we tried were the "President, Double Yellowtail, King of Ocean and Kiss of Fire. ...too delicious. ..seafood salad was a good teaser,and that Golden spoon too delicious. ..So happy we came in for this treat.. We will be back again real soon since I don't eat meat on Fridays only seafood

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiss of fire

K2Sd6g9z_57TnTY11yrgkQ.text: Nice environment. Got K Pop playing in the background! Sports playing on another tv, and Shark Tank on another tv! The sushi tastes fresh, and they are very generous with their portions. We are very happy that Goyemon had an hour and a half wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love you roll and Spicy Tako Poke

iaEOkRpkMZheLS9O0XyPFA.text: Sushi 21 does not disappoint.   This restaurant has a plethora of sushi, rolls, appetizers,  and desserts to choose from.  I recommend the all you can eat option so you can try a little bit of everything.   I definitely love coming here and recommend it to all my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi roll

glsnC_Sh0s2NSEhkJAesfA.text: You've got to be kidding me; $10 for 6 pieces of mediocre sushi?!?!  Highway robbery...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10 for 6 pieces of mediocre sushi...

S4hEt9cZx2fPrQwYDPu-vg.text: Excellent service for our big family of 9. The food was delicious and the hot tea was at a perfect temperature. We'll definitely be back soon! :)

T93wAdbO9BxSa_7x6sMxYA.text: The peach sangria is delish!!!! I'm glad we ordered the pitcher! The lunch buffet is $21.95 per person which is not bad at all considering they have like 30+++ rolls to choose from. We ordered the Johnny which was so refreshing as its all seafood wrapped in cucumber, dynamite which is wonderful and the bake call op which is overflowing with scallops omg. Also the jalapeno boom, shrimp tempura and baked mussel where our delicious appetizers. Getting the buffet is well worth it... did I mention they have like over 30+++ rolls?? Yes, that's a lot to choose from. By the way mochi is also included in te all you can!! Winning!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite! Kaboom!!
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitcher of peach sangria, baked mussel, jalapeño boom, baked lobster
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Johnny - crab tempura shrimp wrapped in cucumber with yum yum sauce

vrOEbTbJaQ7MmwKLpXZf2g.text: Ordinary sushi joint. Nothing really stood out except for the following:  They don't serve soft shell crab (my favorite), hand rolls and their uni was definitely not fresh.   The uni was a brown pasty color that resembled beef, opposed to the bright yellow/orange. The chef claimed that the uni was bought that morning and can provide a receipt. The chef stated that the uni was brown due to "the wind," aka oxidation.   The servers were nice and I was super impressed with their memory! They retained all of our orders verbally and did not take any notes.   The AYCE was about $27/person.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AxTDCJqQsdOaNa2gNR-gmw.text: Top notch ayce sushi. Great food. Lovely service. Well worth a visit! We had a great meal and they were really accommodating with allergies and specific foods we don't eat.  Thanks and see you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good, we are so much... One piece left... Who wants it?  Love this place!

9mrTM7RxMrgVBmrGZCCnKg.text: Came from California for a short vacation, and came across Sushi 21. Very pleasant service, and our group of seven people thought that the food was very tasty and fresh. Recommending this place.

eqLFy3In4Ch-neu40aw-cw.text: They give discounts for yelp reviews, so I'm pretty sure their score would be at 2 1/2 I'm giving them 1 to make up for the fake reviews of 5 stars.  Well here we go: The rice wasn't soft at all it was dry and crunchy so gross.  I ordered salmon sashimi and it tasted old and fishy. Another gross. I ordered the oysters and if ya like dirt, she'll, and yet again a fishy tang then by all means get them. When I order oysters I want the ocean and the texture. The edamame was probably the only thing they got right.  I forgot what my friends ate but they said the tempura was not good and didn't like the carrots. They got my receipt right but messed my friends up twice! The first time they charged them what I ordered, then they charged them twice for something they only ordered one of.  They were not busy at all. Also if you live in Vegas I'm visiting from San Francisco so my sushi standards might be higher but this isn't a place I'd go back to not for the price they charge for mediocre sushi.

kYzHA__L9RMjOJuszBlpJg.text: Wow!  So delicious. Maybe we ordered too much, but that is ok. Excellent friendly service and lively music keeps us entertained.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p8VSdoQpg4TF3Sowssno-Q.text: Sushi 21 is one of our long time go tos. The service is quick and friendly, the sushi is always fresh, and they play K Pop videos. Be sure to check out the white peach sangria. Delish!

EEjqG6hnBA70BPMEGPtEMQ.text: Excellent Sushi! $21.00 all you can eat sushi for lunch...not bad at all!

mvXjWKoPzItdyq_iUebKwA.text: This place is very festive and has a large selection of dishes. I like that they offer Brown rice even though there is an additional charge for it.

fQyCNjtuCGh42bQxOh-uFw.text: I ate here for lunch, I took the teriyaki chicken bento box I took white meat, the chicken was so so,too mushi. I took brown rice and the box comes with tempura vegetables and half a Philadelphia roll. Not sure if I'll take the chicken again, sushi seemed ok, I'll give the place one more chance. In general great atmosphere and great service

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bento chicken teriyaki for lunch

sg7SmoDXOnYjGOzLTGWU4w.text: Highly recommend! An easy Uber ride from the strip for all you can eat sushi! For dinner we paid $27 and had the option to choose from over 80 different items including appetizers and desserts! Recommend the Something Wrong 69 roll. Great customer service too!

kQVK3HtwOtkcZIcDtChb0w.text: Not sure why theres so many positive reviews, but sushi was just ok. Nigiri taste fine. I like that the nigiri was small, but rolls were stuffed with imitation crab. Half the menu were spicy rolls. Crunchy lobster roll was just ok. Wasnt busy at all and they forgot a roll. The service was really good, the menu is large, and servers were nice and tentative, but pass on this place and try goyemon next door.

Zy9Ih2xkyY3q9wRN8wJKHQ.text: Had lunch here for the first time, it was fresh and service was good for an ayce place.

jOLrcsxhAKgqG8xG0GUaZg.text: Awesome weekday lunch special. Very reasonably priced, super tasty, great service.  No parking issues. Will definitely be back!

CYZWA3GG5PeZXLhT6QrVWg.text: Been here a solid 10 times since moving here summer of 2015. One of the best sushi spots in Vegas. When it's my turn to pick where we soosh, it's always sushi 21. I sound like a commercial but it's really that good. Happy hour is worth it and the sake is always bogo. I stay in aliante but still make it a point to come down here for the rolls.

HW8oCe5lgvekmBNZeXaZKA.text: This place serves delicious food! I ordered from them on UberEats. **Mussels are one of my top three things that I have to get when I order from a sushi restaurant. The Mussels are absolutely delicious. They give you five pieces which is a pretty great value.   **The Dynamite scallops were tasty as well. The MGM roll was big and topped with a huge pile of spicy tuna, it comes with a yummy dipping sauce. **The best thing about this whole order was the restaurant gave me a free roll on the house. I believe it was Spicy Tuna and Spicy Tuna is my favorite(Top 1).  Thank you!! It was such an awesome suprise!!  **I will definitely order from here again!!!

EMaGRtFe-hc8PHg6R9IApQ.text: Great service while we were here. The food was really good, too.  We ordered several items and had no complaints.  The hostess, who I assume is an owner, was really nice and attentive.

UGNeZNz_47MVY_5OlNqK4Q.text: Such a great all you can eat spot! Went in for dinner..they have an anniversary deal going on for $19.95. Great quality fish, amazing service and cool music videos playing.   Next time going to try and save room for dessert!

wA7ICQVPOvVwAXhlYUCF7g.text: Me an hubby went in last night after work for drinks an dinner we ordered 3 drink an some food  while we were eating we keep being asked is there anything else before we could finish anything this is a place me an hubby like to go to unwind an enjoy I don't think we will be back witch is sad but me an hubby both felt like we were being rushed to leave not a good feeling to have as we were loyal customers

Uq9pVtv1Xz2PiI2uFMxU7Q.text: Update 1 year later: Service AND food was great! I had the grilled salmon bento and my dinner companions had the AYCE.  Everyone enjoyed their food, and the service was friendly and very good.  2018: I enjoyed their vegetable and shrimp tempura and their chicken yakitori. The rest of my party was not so happy with the all you can eat sushi, and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great restaurant to meet friends and family for sushi!

xPvXboHql-6GScFb6ww2qw.text: After working out for 2 group X classes @ 24 Hour Fitness, I found this place. Ordered Las Vegas roll, popcorn lobster, green valley roll &  philly roll to go & bring back to my home in strip. They added 4 pieces of salmon nigiri on the house, wow! This place definitely ROCKS!!!

yG-C_0NvDDzdnL-BCLOong.text: I came here for lunch and I'm so disappointed. There are only 4 people inside of the whole place. I came in and one other person came in at the same time, there was just us when I placed my order. I have been waiting for 40 minutes now and had to cancel it. Wasted my lunch time here for nothing. Never again will I come back here or recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty restaurant and over 30 minutes wait for my order...

qviPwJ8y_0wQg_6mGkYxUA.text: Considering you are in a mall in the middle of the desert, this place has very good sushi. It is "all you can eat," which I never do. I ordered the lunch special, which was cheaper than the AYCE option. Sushi melted in my mouth. Miso was very good. Service was excellent. They forgot our edamame, but took it off the bill when we pointed it out.   The place is fairly small and the decor is so-so. Many sushi place is Las Vegas are far more expensive than this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

aJJqUAH8k8ABqKbdSK1vbg.text: Stubbled upon this restaurant as I walking out of another one. Clearly what caught my eye was All You Can Eat. Definitely, had to give this place a hit. Located off the strip not far from Chinatown off of Decatur. In a strip mall.  The place isn't that big. There's a good about of tables and the sushi bar is right when you walk in.   The menu offers plenty of rolls to choose from as well as classic sushi. And as stated, All You Can Eat. Heads up, it does get busy so place your order on what you want so you can start from there. I ordered a good amount starting off. Incase it got busy and the it may take too long till the next order. Just like every place that offers this, if you leave any leftover you will be charge. So order accordingly. As long as you start with a good amount, you can just go from there. Downfall, the sushi was a tad small compare to other places I've been too. Price is great for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B8j-ERzD6ofihwsXRxaC5Q.text: I had a short half-hour for lunch before an appointment nearby, so I popped in for a chirashi bowl. Portion was huge, cuts were thick, and fish was pretty fresh. They only use the more common fish (salmon, tuna, yellowtail, etc), no eel, scallop, octopus, etc. but I liked how the ikura was served in an avocado bowl. Price is comparable to others, but did not include soup. Staff were polite and prompt.   TIPS: You can place online orders with the Yelp app, extensive AYCE menu more popular than a la carte here. Location is affiliated with Sushi Cruise (east side).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chirashi

LwRhyhK-yHoVr6cfxt5uvQ.text: Ohhh stop and go try Sushi21!  Everything is so good and full of sweet waiter/waitress! We love it! Thank you Jeff for making our lady nite special

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gAdnHy8oKbJQgD-RsTn3mg.text: Sushi 21 is a cute little place with very pleasant staff.  They were projecting what I think was K-Pop videos on the wall, and it was wonderful.  The sushi is great too, and they had an all you can eat option.  What else can you ask for?

SGMmgqbTcDnFVT3u_Xnhzw.text: Sushi was great! We went around lunch time but no one was there at all. Didn't complain about that at all but it did worried me for a second.  The only thing that's keeping me from giving this restaurant 5 stars, is the fact that the sushi tasted a little bit "fishy", especially the mussels. The thing is that sushi shouldn't have a "fishy" flavor.   All in all, it was good. Good presentation as we for each plate! I'll definitely visit again but I'd want to try the others.  Oh and one thing also. The customer service was a bit wonky for me. I agree with one of the reviews posted earlier with "being watched." The server kept looking over us and I just wasn't comfortable with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

asBGfLBWrAXm7IeuzzKFDw.text: So I was craving sushi for lunch again and, as usual, my eyes were bigger than my stomach. I prefer AYCE sushi spots that allow half-size rolls because I enjoy trying a lot of the variety, and it's a better price value than a la carte whether you're dining solo or sharing the experience. Sushi 21's menu offers a fantastic assortment of sushi and appetizers that easily satisfied my appetite.   It wasn't busy inside since it was late afternoon on a week day, but that didn't affect the high quality of sushi and service I received from the staff. I chose to sit at a table because of the comfy booth seats, and I actually had two friendly servers checking on me every few minutes to make sure I was happy with my food. I didn't feel like I was being hounded by them at all because they kept a short distance away unless I needed my empty plates removed or my water refilled. I appreciated the casual and relaxed atmosphere where you can feel at ease even when you're the only diner in the room.    The talented chefs prepared my orders in a timely manner, and I was pretty much gobbling all the deliciousness down as my items came. I had forgotten to mark the Dynamite as a half size, and I didn't realize how full my stomach was feeling until I saw that the plate had eight sushi rolls underneath the topping instead of four! It was my last order too, and I really should've stopped, except that my digestion hadn't caught up with my brain until it was too late. I don't like wasting food, and I told the server that I'd pay for the remaining uneaten Dynamite. They were kind enough to just let me take it home without extra charge since I did still manage to at least finish half of it (despite the pitiful protesting of my nearly exploding belly). ;p  Anyway, this was what I ate (my appetizers arrived first and sushi later): Baked mussels- (3 pieces) light and flavorful! Crab pockets (2 pieces)- fried cream cheese and crab rangoons Shrimp Tempura- (3 pieces) delightfully crispy Cucumber salad- sweet and vinegary Alligator roll- deep fried eel on top, crab inside Baked Lobster roll- lobster salad mix on top Dynamite roll- corn, scallops, mushrooms, crab mix  It didn't seem like a lot at first -- until I started eating. The amount of sushi rice was minimal, so I was really getting full from the substantial portions of the other ingredients. I wish I could train my stomach to hold more food, but I'm definitely coming back to gorge myself on the rest of Sushi 21's menu! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite Sushi (full order)-baked mixture of corn, scallops, mushroom on top with crab inside. I ate 2 pieces already...
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alligator Sushi- deep fried eel on top!
Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Pockets Appetizer- basically a fried rangoon stuffed with crab-cream cheese mix, yummm!

9yzT4z5vaP188uaJUmOe-Q.text: I was super excited to go to another ayce sushi place in Vegas! I know they have the best variety for your dollar too. I'm deducting two stars for some mishaps however.   Food was good! Amazingly good. The sauces. The fish. The variety. The waiter forgot to hand us back our sheet with what we ordered sooo I'm sorry I can't remember the names of the rolls we ordered :( my favorite had salmon on top. Inside was crab and shrimp tempura. ) I'm assuming maybe the waiter did not bring back the paper because he thought we were done eating. But you should still always bring it back after each round just in case.    We actually ordered other rolls but got full and told the waiter to cancel the upcoming rolls.  He said sure but one roll still came to our table from a different waitress.. I felt bad to tell them to please take it back and reminded them our other rolls were canceled...   Also they have typos on their menu which is frustrating. It wasn't until after I finished eating that I saw the correction at the bottom of the menu "rolls that say 6pcs are actually 8pcs but you can ask for half roll of 4pcs". UGH why why why didn't I see that sooner???????? I would've tried way more rolls in half quantity and not been confused why I have 8 instead of 6 ... please just get new menus and fix them. Don't do a little note. It's just lazy. Or atleast put that Little note at the top of the menu where people are more likely to see it.   The menu to order gives you only 2 rounds. Most places give you 3. Also, there's no section for appetizers and desserts to check what you want. There's a memo section in the back so that helps I guess.   There must not be much communication happening because two diff waiters came to us and we reminded them we've been waiting for our shrimp tempura for awhile. Our wonton soup never came so we didn't even mention it. And we ended up getting two plates of the tempura :/ plus it's an appetizer so it was kinda pointless eating it at the end of our meal but oh well. We overheard another table asking for the same thing so it wasn't just us.   If the service could be a little better, that would make this a definite 5 stars. The food was great. I just had a few disappointments.

IosCjUds5F2vdkxFd3ZJBw.text: My husband and I tried this place. I work next door at 24 hour fitness. Waiting for the time my hubby can join.  Lunch 21.95$ and dinner 26.95$ all you can eat Sushi. Since living here we have been unable to find one.   Anyway, service was perfect and our server was very efficient and kind and full of smiles. Clean inside and let us get to the food.  We ordered 4 rolls and appetizers. One of appetizers we order was muscles. They were dripping with garlic butter/sauce perfectly cooked not dry not swishy.   Then we ordered some rolls. Spicy crab some sushi (crab eel etc) and the sauces they used on some of the rolls really added some extra tastes of happiness to each roll. We ordered an orange blossom. It came with a light creamy garlic sauce. My only complaint although every good. I personally would have wanted it slightly warm. The rolls were not rolled really tight and often came apart when eating. The only things i would have change personally. But have no fear not tightly rolled sushi and chilled garlic sauce on my orange blossom doesn't change a thing. It was a great Resturant. Highly recommend. So forgive my spelling errors and context. I wanted to do this review before my sushi wears off. My glasses are not my usual pair as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi 21 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster popcorn roll

3f7Z-mVXlIy8t-oB2NClzg.text: All you can eat sushi for like $20 is such a deal, food was good only sent one roll back because I didn't like avocado & cream cheese together. The waitress was cute and very nice. I choked on a piece of sushi and threw up in my jacket sleeve. Sorry. I cleaned it up but I know the guy making sushi at the bar saw it and was watching me the whole time but I pretended not to notice. 10/10 would eat here again.

rwVsqVTYSi-0EEIzOu7Nng.text: This location is right next to where I live so it's very convenient to pick up dinner on the way home from work. I have only ordered carry out here and the service has always been friendly and my food was always on time.   I usually get the chirashi bowl and its just the perfect amount.  It comes in a nice presentation and all the good fixings a chirashi bowl should have. I like to order their hand rolls too and they are very generous with the hand roll portions, did I mention tasty too?

C0AaWOVeeYrERo6cZLZfng.text: Honestly the service started out really really badly. The waitress didn't have a damn clue about the menu at all and I've been here at least 20 times. But tonight I wanted to try something new. Mind you, it's always really good here. But tonight I don't know what was happening. She ended up just getting her jacket on and walking out after handing us our first messed up roll.   Now I know you're wondering why this is a 5 star review. Well, the waitress and the guy (Jeff) afterwards completely fixed everything and they were so nice and friendly. They completely made the night and the food started coming out great. THATS the sushi 21 I know. So big thanks to Jeff and the sweet lady afterwards. You guys are really appreciated.

_lpQvCKo8lI3CscHFnfU6g.text: This sushi restaurant is one of the worst if not the worst I have ever been to. Its surprising because Las Vegas is well known for amazing sushi.  The service was not inviting, the fish was dry and looked like it was sitting out all day. The salmon wasn't fresh. It tasted almost rotten. The rice was dry and had a salty after taste. It was so bad that even the dessert was horrible.  The green tea ice cream tasted artificial.  For the all you can eat option, well they made it uncomfortable to order by reminding us that they charge for leftovers.  This is not our first rodeo and we are very aware of that common policy for all u can eat sushi.  I guess im glad he did warn us because the food was appallingly disgusting.  Im not sure I would have finished my orders. Im sticking with Goyemon or Kaya. This place isnt worth the time and money.

YT_DkJjMp39aNGRkDhNv1g.text: Great late night sushi spot! The Washington roll and the kiss of fire are amazing! The servers were great and the rolls are fresh and smooth.

CQSkkHVrY5Y1LixbaV2Gsw.text: As soon as we walked in we got great service. We got seated and served right away. The Chicken Teriyaki Bento was delicious. The portion of food was good enough to fill up the tummy and the price was reasonable. I will definitely come back again.

Xhmp9eY0zVISjFEhX5Buew.text: Great menu selection for all you can eat sushi! Good customer service. Recommend the green mussels and pretty much all the nigiri they have. Portions are on the smaller side, but thats great to be able to try a variety of things!

OEQKz9wVmEKruYguwkZJpA.text: Great spot! Love all the menu options.  Popcorn lobster is my favorite.  The service is great and the waiters are very friendly.  The location is okay, but it is easy to get to.  This is one of the best AYE sushi spots in Las Vegas.  I hope this was helpful!

WBmYzb1h5rW4J-ExlFzyRg.text: Love these guys. We go here often. Almost every week. Kenny and John are pretty much the best people to sit at  the bar and have make your food. Kenny's always joking, and John loves to party!!  We always do the AYCE, and on fridays and saturdays they do free sake bombs! Err..well sometimes they forget but I'm not really gonna freak out about it, it's FREE. The table service is pretty inconsistent though. I have had AMAZING service (and make sure to let them know with a tip they did well) and then I've had some pretty awful service as well (sitting on an empty drink for 20 minutes, stacks of empty plates waiting to be taken away. I've even seen the chefs having to remind the waitresses to get the food and bring it to the table.) Soo....I gotta knock a star off for that. But I gotta say...as a loyal customer these guys treat us great. From random, "Just try this, don't eat it if you don't like it" rolls, to great recommendations on the AYCE menu. Never had a bad experience with the freshness or quality of the food sooo...not sure what some of the other reviews are talking about. :-\  Advice? Be good to the chefs. If you take care of them, they'll take care of you.

xZ5xnNJg_8kkA-MT9Y2UdA.text: Really fast, really good, and friendly service :) everything tastes fresh. Will definitely be coming back. My top pick for AYCE!

Czy3YdqgRFsZ-He8BcZJmA.text: Great sushi extremely fresh great service. Super awesome upbeat music great vibe. Great prices too! Would defiantly recommend it! 5 star!

n3PUgM1YF12HY1YKe2-XQg.text: Great sushi! Our waitress was great and very friendly. We sat up at the sushi bar and I was thoroughly entertained watching the chefs make our dinner. All You Can Eat was ideal for my fiance and brother cause they destroyed about 10 rolls!

czYvrA94PKOMfQL3U6eVhA.text: We wanted Sushi and never been here before so we figured we would give it a try. From the min we walked in we were treated like we were the only people in the place, although they were pretty full and busy since it was Saturday night.  Our food was great and was served quickly,  we surly will be back.

6cZLe1bfi_LQkOlKXcQnRw.text: The food and service was great, our waitress Anabel was amazing! The atmosphere is great

7JyiGei3uOO-AKpFBbr4xA.text: Wow!!! All-you-can-eat sushi??? What a place!!! Stumbled upon this place on vacation with friends. Not on the strip but close by... They have sports playing the whole time and music videos playing... Awesome place. Food was absolutely great and so much variety, I will definitely be back!!!

r6gA6lw4Hda_jreaBvf7Ow.text: Horrible service !!!! Super slow and they never refill any water/hot tea without me asking. They don't offer half rolls. The two waitress are really rude and they kept reminding me that they charge for rice.... Omg I get it !

t2xM_wNjSkQRA2NQA94uVA.text: Saw the menu looked fantastic, so we ordered All you can eat, then we were given the All you can eat, much less of a selection with the majority of the things I wanted not on it. The shrimp tempura roll had a pile of crunch and no avocado, not bad but different then every other place we go to. Everyone was very friendly.

AJOGKwL6A1g7Z0CfcuFcgw.text: So Good! Best Baked Scallop roll I've had in Vegas! The portions were really generous and the sushi was really fresh tasting. We chose to order a la carte but the all you can eat option is good, although the rolls available are limited. All of the eel rolls are great as well

pWc7bB2n0w0nJhvDkNSfDA.text: Hands down the worst sushi place I ever been to in the entire metro area and I have tried at least 7 other different ones.  Im not sure which was worse the food or the horrid service.  This is the only place that does not let you order half rolls.  Even though  that stipulation its not anywhere to be found on the menu under the rules   The waitress literally yelled at my party of four because we tried to order appetizers before she was finished getting our drinks.   There is a reason why they are never that busy. I will never come back even if the food was free.  Terrible terrible terrible place.  I am convinced every single good review is fake or a friend or relative of someone that works there.  Come here if you want grocery store quality sushi

6hNZT908lzLPGdY-3hrzaw.text: Good fun, cool music, loved the vegetable rolls and the California  rolls were huge! Also the service was smiling and very attentive! Thank you!

xsM4tE7cQxpAcXIWn0AtXA.text: DO NOT GO. I had the worst experience ever!!!!! Sushi was terrible. It was so dry and did not have any flavor at all. We told the waitress we were not going to eat the food because it looked and tasted bad. The sushi chef comes out, finds out about the situation and goes "What the fuck!!!!!." He kept asking us why we couldn't eat the sushi and did not take "Because it tastes terrible" as an answer. After we were done paying, the same chef followed us all the way to the door and started yelling in his own language and started throwing salt all around us. I know in some Asian countries they use salt for purification purpose, and therefore by throwing the salt around us he was treating us as "bad luck." I would be surprised if he still works there because no one would want to hire such a rude crazy chef like him.

fT2tW98xw8d3A94vGDYGgw.text: I ordered takeout. Spicy rolls were very spicy, soup portion was really small as was the cucumber salad which is to die for. They deliver but expect to wait if you call during peak hours. I hate trying sushi when I'm away from home but I was more than satisfied with this restaurant. I recommend it to every friend who visits Vegas. Everyone must try the cucumber salad!

gK2TUMEVmZTFymxJN58Gfg.text: Delicious sushi & fried ice cream. The lobster baked roll was my favorite. Awesome atmosphere & great service!!!

t6ZFAUG46mN7kANwWaJI7Q.text: Extensive menu, fast and friendly service, relaxing atmosphere with fun music, some of the tastiest sushi I have ever eaten! My only complaint is.that my eyes were bigger than my stomach!

-Pg3YrrqdW9O86lP91MxXQ.text: AMAZING!!!! 5/5 stars!!!! excellent customer service. they even gave us a free roll!!! they have cute k pop music in the background. try the deep fried oreo dessert special!!!

TZYGnIuvYyc8rtIUq8OX4g.text: Very average food quality. The uni sushis were very stinking and looked old. Not fresh.  Go to somewhere else.

eNLCCNM3vxyJthXe0np3mg.text: We love everything we ordered here for our all you can eat dinner: albacore sashimi, salmon and tuna sashimi, oysters, garlic tuna, "something wrong" roll etc. The fishes are very fresh, the salmon cuts are thick. We will come back!

A-1KKDvX8txgxG1qWJjacQ.text: I've been back to Sushi 21 twice now in 3 days and both times the service has been excellent. Kudos to Johnny and his preparation and presentation of all menu items across the board. Highly recommended to anyone that enjoys a relaxed atmosphere and great service combined with a large selection of menu items that can be enjoyed at your leisure. Pat was our waiter the first time and Jaden took care of us the second time around and both were attentive and expedient in his delivery of everything that we ordered. We will return EVERY time we're in Las Vegas.

I0pd4XUQCCX4BQ72I6QCGQ.text: What a great place. Our first time here and the sushi was great. Very fresh and a great presentation!! The service was spot on and extremely courteous and friendly. She also helped us pick some of their more popular rolls which ended up being great picks!!!! Can't wait to come here for dinner!!! Would recommend to anyone!!!

DhEP-oopUfLiJCjIN56fVw.text: Great service. Open late. Friendly staff. Fresh food and served quick. Ordered quite a few sushi's and all were good. Also ordered few rolls and we're not disappointed. Will be back.
